snippet: Under pressure from a Federal judge, air quality regulators in southern California adopted on Friday what they called the nation's toughest curbs on ozone-depleting emissions from cleaning solvents.    The move by the regulators, the South Coast A...
lead_paragraph: Under pressure from a Federal judge, air quality regulators in southern California adopted on Friday what they called the nation's toughest curbs on ozone-depleting emissions from cleaning solvents. The move by the regulators, the South Coast Air Quality Management District board, followed a ruling in August by Judge Harry Hupp of United States District Court that the agency had to toughen the limits.
abstract: Air quality regulators in southern California, under pressure from Federal judge, adopt what they call nation's toughest curbs on ozone-depleting emissions from cleaning solvents (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; Regulators in California Toughen Emission Limits
